suncertify.db
Interface Data.RecordsHandler

All Known Implementing Classes:
CachingRecordsHandler
Enclosing class:
Data
public static interface Data.RecordsHandler

Defines the strategy for database file records bytes read/write operations to be used by an instance of Data.

The synchronizing for read/write operations for calling threads must be handled by the implementer.

Method Summary
 int create(byte[] record)
          Write new record bytes record to database file stream then return the record number assigned to it.
 void delete(int recNo)
          Mark record with number recNo as deleted.
 byte[] read(int recNo)
          Read bytes for record with no recNo.
 void update(int recNo, byte[] record)
          Update record bytes for record with number recNo with bytes record.
 

Method Detail

read

byte[] read(int recNo)
            throws RecordNotFoundException,
                   java.io.IOException
Read bytes for record with no recNo.

Parameters:
recNo - the number of record to be read.
Returns:
bytes of read record.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if record does not exist in database file or deleted.
java.io.IOException - when writing to database file stream is failed.

create

int create(byte[] record)
           throws java.io.IOException
Write new record bytes record to database file stream then return the record number assigned to it.

Returned record number can be the result of appending newly created record at the rare of file or reusing a deleted record position.

Parameters:
record - new record bytes to be added to database file stream.
Returns:
record number assigned to newly created record.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if writing for record bytes is failed.

update

void update(int recNo,
            byte[] record)
            throws RecordNotFoundException,
                   java.io.IOException
Update record bytes for record with number recNo with bytes record.

Parameters:
recNo - record number to be updated.
record - new record bytes.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if record does not exist in database or deleted.
java.io.IOException - when writing for record bytes is failed.

delete

void delete(int recNo)
            throws RecordNotFoundException,
                   java.io.IOException
Mark record with number recNo as deleted.

After the record is deleted the implementer has the choice of reusing its space as a free space when adding new records.

Parameters:
recNo - record number to be marked as deleted.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if record does not exist in database file or deleted.
java.io.IOException - if marking for records bytes as deleted is failed.
